repnme.cdata!:
Turkey - Second Phase-Out of Ozone
            Depleting Substances Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Second Phase-Out of
            Ozone Depleting Substances (PODS) Project in Turkey were as
            follows: outcomes were satisfactory, the risk to global
            environment outcome was low or negligible, the Bank
            performance was highly satisfactory, and the Borrower
            performance was also highly satisfactory. Lessons learned
            included: from project approval in 1995 until completion in
            2007, the World Bank Task Manager and the Turkish Technology
            Development Foundation (TTGV) Project Manager remained on
            the project. This resulted in substantial continuity of
            project knowledge, helped consensus building with officials
            of pertinent government agencies, and an enhanced ability to
            streamline project procedures. TTGV and Non- Governmental
            Organization (NGO) possessed the technical and
            administrative knowledge to manage PODS-II very effectively.
            The agency's contacts with Small and Medium Enterprises
            (SMEs) facilitated their promulgation of PODS requirements
            and identification of potential grant/loan applicants. Their
            experience in PODS-I was very helpful in understanding
            project requirements and facilitating contact with relevant
            Government of Turkey (GoT) agencies. Although Ministry of
            Environment and Forestry (MoEF), Ministry of Agriculture and
            Rural Affairs (MARA), and the Under secretariat of Customs
            had collaborated during PODS-I, at the start of PODS-II
            their efforts to coordinate and reach a policy consensus
            with business on development of regulations and
            implementation of the National Ozone Plan was
            time-consuming. Through many interactions and meetings
            during PODS-II, their contacts improved greatly and became
            much more efficient.

694314.trustfund:
TF021963-OTF:PROJECT PREPARATION ADVANCE
            PROCESSING UNDER TURKEY PODS II,TF021942-OTF-TURKEY ODS II

repnme.cdata!:
Turkey - Second Phase-Out of Ozone
            Depleting Substances Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Second Phaseout of
            Ozone Depleting Substances Project is to assist the
            Government of Turkey (GOT) in ensuring that Ozone Depleting
            Substances (ODS)-using industries in Turkey effectively and
            efficiently phaseout ODS usage through the adoption of
            non-ODS technologies.  The policy and regulatory measures
            will also be monitored as agreed under the First Phaseout of
            Ozone Depleting Substances Project (PODS-I).  The phaseout
            is to be effected in compliance with the Protocol, as
            ratified by the Republic of Turkey, and in accordance with
            the recommended ODS phaseout strategy and action plan
            outlined in the Country Program.  The project will provide
            financial assistance to enterprises in all sectors for
            adoption of non-ODS technologies.  Investment costs include
            manufacturing and processing equipments, prototyping and
            testing safety equipments for handling hazardous substances,
            and technology transfer and safety training.  Recurring
            costs cover incremental operating costs arising from the
            technology conversion.
